heading: passage: robert shaw, 82
subheading: shaw, longtime conductor of the atlanta symphony orchestra, was regarded as one of the world's leading choral directors. he founded his own choral group in the 1940s and helped extend the art form, which has deep roots in europe and in the united states. he also helped transform the atlanta symphony, virtually an amateur group when he took the reins, into a leading american orchestra. shaw won 14 grammy awards and was inducted into the american classical music hall of fame in 1998.
author: wired staff
